options.help: Use a single Pre-shard Key (PSK) to authenticate all users.
options.name: psk

options.help: Use a RADIUS server to authenticate clients.
options.name: radius

options.help: Use a firewall usergroup to authenticate clients.
options.name: usergroup

broadcast-suppression.help: Optional suppression of broadcast messages. For example, you can keep DHCP messages, ARP broadcasts, and so on off of the wireless network.
broadcast-suppression.name: broadcast-suppression

options.help: Suppress broadcast DHCP starvation req messages.
options.name: dhcp-starvation

options.help: Convert downlink broadcast DHCP messages to unicast messages.
options.name: dhcp-ucast

options.help: Suppress broadcast ARP for known wireless clients.
options.name: arp-known

options.help: Suppress broadcast ARP for unknown wireless clients.
options.name: arp-unknown

options.help: Suppress broadcast ARP reply from wireless clients.
options.name: arp-reply

options.help: Suppress ARP poison messages from wireless clients.
options.name: arp-poison

options.help: Reply ARP requests for wireless clients as a proxy.
options.name: arp-proxy

options.help: Suppress NetBIOS name services packets with UDP port 137.
options.name: netbios-ns

options.help: Suppress NetBIOS datagram services packets with UDP port 138.
options.name: netbios-ds

captive-portal-auth-timeout.help: Hard timeout - AP will always clear the session after timeout regardless of traffic (0 - 864000 sec, default = 0).
captive-portal-auth-timeout.name: captive-portal-auth-timeout

dhcp-lease-time.help: DHCP lease time in seconds for NAT IP address.
dhcp-lease-time.name: dhcp-lease-time

dhcp-option43-insertion.help: Enable/disable insertion of DHCP option 43 (default = enable).
dhcp-option43-insertion.name: dhcp-option43-insertion

dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertion.help: Enable/disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert (default = disable).
dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertion.name: dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertion

options.help: ASCII string composed of AP-MAC;SSID;SSID-TYPE. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx;wifi;s".
options.name: style-1

options.help: ASCII string composed of AP-MAC. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
options.name: style-2

dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertion.help: Enable/disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert (default = disable).
dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertion.name: dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertion

options.help: ASCII string in the format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx" containing MAC address of client device.
options.name: style-1

eap-reauth.help: Enable/disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
eap-reauth.name: eap-reauth

options.help: Enable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.name: disable

eapol-key-retries.help: Enable/disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2) (default = enable).
eapol-key-retries.name: eapol-key-retries

options.help: Disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
options.name: disable

options.help: Enable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
options.name: enable

encrypt.help: Encryption protocol to use (only available when security is set to a WPA type).
encrypt.name: encrypt

external-fast-roaming.help: Enable/disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs not managed by the FortiGate (default = disable).
external-fast-roaming.name: external-fast-roaming

options.help: Enable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
options.name: disable

external-logout.help: URL of external authentication logout server.
external-logout.name: external-logout

external-web.help: URL of external authentication web server.
external-web.name: external-web

options.help: Automatically detect if "external-web" URL has any query parameter.
options.name: auto-detect

options.help: "external-web" URL does not have any query parameter.
options.name: no-query-string

fast-roaming.help: Enable/disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication, where supported by clients (default = disable).
fast-roaming.name: fast-roaming

ft-mobility-domain.help: Mobility domain identifier in FT (1 - 65535, default = 1000).
ft-mobility-domain.name: ft-mobility-domain

ft-over-ds.help: Enable/disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
ft-over-ds.name: ft-over-ds

options.help: Disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
options.name: disable

options.help: Enable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
options.name: enable

ft-r0-key-lifetime.help: Lifetime of the PMK-R0 key in FT, 1-65535 minutes.
ft-r0-key-lifetime.name: ft-r0-key-lifetime

gtk-rekey.help: Enable/disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
gtk-rekey.name: gtk-rekey

options.help: Enable GTK rekey for WPA security.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
options.name: disable

intra-vap-privacy.help: Enable/disable blocking communication between clients on the same SSID (called intra-SSID privacy) (default = disable).
intra-vap-privacy.name: intra-vap-privacy

ip.help: IP address and subnet mask for the local standalone NAT subnet.
ip.name: ip

ipv6-rules.help: Optional rules of IPv6 packets. For example, you can keep RA, RS and so on off of the wireless network.
ipv6-rules.name: ipv6-rules

options.help: Drop ICMP6 Router Advertisement (RA) packets that originate from wireless clients.
options.name: drop-icmp6ra

options.help: Drop ICMP6 Router Solicitation (RS) packets to be sent to wireless clients.
options.name: drop-icmp6rs

options.help: Drop Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution (LLMNR) packets
options.name: drop-llmnr6

options.help: Drop ICMP6 Multicast Listener Report V2 (MLD2) packets
options.name: drop-icmp6mld2

options.help: Drop DHCP6 server generated packets that originate from wireless clients.
options.name: drop-dhcp6s

options.help: Drop DHCP6 client generated packets to be sent to wireless clients.
options.name: drop-dhcp6c

options.help: Enable IPv6 ndp proxy - send back na on behalf of the client and drop the ns.
options.name: ndp-proxy

options.help: Drop ICMP6 NS-DAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
options.name: drop-ns-dad

options.help: Drop ICMP6 NS-NonDAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
options.name: drop-ns-nondad

options.help: Enable LDPC when both receiving and transmitting traffic.
options.name: rxtx

local-bridging.help: Enable/disable bridging of wireless and Ethernet interfaces on the FortiAP (default = disable).
local-bridging.name: local-bridging

options.help: Enable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
options.name: disable

local-lan.help: Allow/deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address (default = allow).
local-lan.name: local-lan

options.help: Allow traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
options.name: allow

options.help: Deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
options.name: deny

local-standalone-nat.help: Enable/disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
local-standalone-nat.name: local-standalone-nat

options.help: Enable AP local standalone NAT mode.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
options.name: disable

mac-filter.help: Enable/disable MAC filtering to block wireless clients by mac address.
mac-filter.name: mac-filter

mac-filter-policy.help: Deny or allow the client with this MAC address.
mac-filter-policy.name: mac-filter-policy

options.help: Allow the client with this MAC address.
options.name: allow

options.help: Block the client with this MAC address.
options.name: deny

mac-filter-list.help: Create a list of MAC addresses for MAC address filtering.
mac-filter-list.name: mac-filter-list

mac-filter-policy-other.help: Allow or block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
mac-filter-policy-other.name: mac-filter-policy-other

options.help: Allow clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
options.name: allow

options.help: Block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
options.name: deny

max-clients.help: Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
max-clients.name: max-clients

max-clients-ap.help: Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP per AP radio (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
max-clients-ap.name: max-clients-ap

me-disable-thresh.help: Disable multicast enhancement when this many clients are receiving multicast traffic.
me-disable-thresh.name: me-disable-thresh

mesh-backhaul.help: Enable/disable using this VAP as a WiFi mesh backhaul (default = disable). This entry is only available when security is set to a WPA type or open.
mesh-backhaul.name: mesh-backhaul

multicast-enhance.help: Enable/disable converting multicast to unicast to improve performance (default = disable).
multicast-enhance.name: multicast-enhance

passphrase.help: WPA pre-shared key (PSK) to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
passphrase.name: passphrase

options.help: Enable PMF but deny clients without PMF.
options.name: enable

options.help: Enable PMF and allow clients without PMF.
options.name: optional

pmf-assoc-comeback-timeout.help: Protected Management Frames (PMF) comeback maximum timeout (1-20 sec).
pmf-assoc-comeback-timeout.name: pmf-assoc-comeback-timeout

pmf-sa-query-retry-timeout.help: Protected Management Frames (PMF) SA query retry timeout interval (1 - 5 100s of msec).
pmf-sa-query-retry-timeout.name: pmf-sa-query-retry-timeout

portal-message-override-group.help: Replacement message group for this VAP (only available when security is set to a captive portal type).
portal-message-override-group.name: portal-message-override-group

auth-disclaimer-page.help: Override auth-disclaimer-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.
auth-disclaimer-page.name: auth-disclaimer-page

auth-login-failed-page.help: Override auth-login-failed-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.
auth-login-failed-page.name: auth-login-failed-page

auth-login-page.help: Override auth-login-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.
auth-login-page.name: auth-login-page

auth-reject-page.help: Override auth-reject-page message with message from portal-message-overrides group.
auth-reject-page.name: auth-reject-page

portal-type.help: Captive portal functionality. Configure how the captive portal authenticates users and whether it includes a disclaimer.
portal-type.name: portal-type

options.help: Portal for CMCC and MAC authentication.
options.name: cmcc-macauth

options.help: Portal for authentication and MAC authentication.
options.name: auth-mac

primary-wag-profile.help: Primary wireless access gateway profile name.
primary-wag-profile.name: primary-wag-profile

probe-resp-suppression.help: Enable/disable probe response suppression (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
probe-resp-suppression.name: probe-resp-suppression

probe-resp-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to probe requests (-95 to -20, default = -80).
probe-resp-threshold.name: probe-resp-threshold

ptk-rekey.help: Enable/disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
ptk-rekey.name: ptk-rekey

options.help: Enable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
options.name: disable

radio-2g-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 2.4G band (-95 to -20, default = -79).
radio-2g-threshold.name: radio-2g-threshold

radio-5g-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 5G band(-95 to -20, default = -76).
radio-5g-threshold.name: radio-5g-threshold

radio-sensitivity.help: Enable/disable software radio sensitivity (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
radio-sensitivity.name: radio-sensitivity

radius-mac-auth.help: Enable/disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication of clients (default = disable).
radius-mac-auth.name: radius-mac-auth

radius-mac-auth-usergroups.help: Selective user groups that are permitted for RADIUS mac authentication.
radius-mac-auth-usergroups.name: radius-mac-auth-usergroups

radius-server.help: RADIUS server to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
radius-server.name: radius-server

sae-password.help: WPA3 SAE password to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
sae-password.name: sae-password

schedule.help: Firewall schedules for enabling this VAP on the FortiAP. This VAP will be enabled when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
schedule.name: schedule

secondary-wag-profile.help: Secondary wireless access gateway profile name.
secondary-wag-profile.name: secondary-wag-profile

security.help: Security mode for the wireless interface (default = wpa2-only-personal).
security.name: security

security-exempt-list.help: Optional security exempt list for captive portal authentication.
security-exempt-list.name: security-exempt-list

security-redirect-url.help: Optional URL for redirecting users after they pass captive portal authentication.
security-redirect-url.name: security-redirect-url

selected-usergroups.help: Selective user groups that are permitted to authenticate.
selected-usergroups.name: selected-usergroups

ssid.help: IEEE 802.11 service set identifier (SSID) for the wireless interface. Users who wish to use the wireless network must configure their computers to access this SSID name.
ssid.name: ssid

sticky-client-remove.help: Enable/disable sticky client remove to maintain good signal level clients in SSID. (default = disable).
sticky-client-remove.name: sticky-client-remove

sticky-client-threshold-2g.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 2G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -79).
sticky-client-threshold-2g.name: sticky-client-threshold-2g

sticky-client-threshold-5g.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 5G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).
sticky-client-threshold-5g.name: sticky-client-threshold-5g

tunnel-echo-interval.help: The time interval to send echo to both primary and secondary tunnel peers (1 - 65535 sec, default = 300).
tunnel-echo-interval.name: tunnel-echo-interval

tunnel-fallback-interval.help: The time interval for secondary tunnel to fall back to primary tunnel (0 - 65535 sec, default = 7200).
tunnel-fallback-interval.name: tunnel-fallback-interval

usergroup.help: Firewall user group to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
usergroup.name: usergroup

vlan-auto.help: Enable/disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
vlan-auto.name: vlan-auto

options.help: Enable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
options.name: disable

vlan-pooling.help: Enable/disable VLAN pooling, to allow grouping of multiple wireless controller VLANs into VLAN pools (default = disable). When set to wtp-group, VLAN pooling occurs with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
vlan-pooling.name: vlan-pooling

options.help: Enable VLAN pooling with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
options.name: wtp-group

options.help: Enable VLAN pooling with round-robin VLAN assignment.
options.name: round-robin

options.help: Enable VLAN pooling with hash-based VLAN assignment.
options.name: hash

voice-enterprise.help: Enable/disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming (default = disable).
voice-enterprise.name: voice-enterprise
